attributes.action: reconsider the UK's commitment to democracy in light of the recent recognition of the Chinese rule over Tibet
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: On 15th November 2008 the BBC reported "A senior Chinese official has welcomed the UK's decision to recognise Beijing's direct rule over Tibet."  Can the UK really be considered committed to democracy while politically supporting the position of a one party state over the rights of a nation to self determination?
